places_to_visit.name: Golden Gate Bridge
places_to_visit.description: The Golden Gate Bridge is an iconic suspension bridge that connects San Francisco to Marin County. It's known for its stunning architecture and offers breathtaking views of the bay and city skyline.

places_to_visit.name: Alcatraz Island
places_to_visit.description: Alcatraz Island is home to the infamous former prison that housed some of America's most notorious criminals. Tours of the island provide insight into its history and offer spectacular views of San Francisco Bay.

places_to_visit.name: Fisherman's Wharf
places_to_visit.description: Fisherman's Wharf is a bustling waterfront area known for its seafood restaurants, shops, and attractions. Key spots include Pier 39, home to a colony of sea lions, and the Aquarium of the Bay.

places_to_visit.name: Chinatown
places_to_visit.description: San Francisco's Chinatown is the oldest and one of the largest in North America. It features vibrant street markets, traditional Chinese architecture, and authentic restaurants.

activities: Walk or bike across the Golden Gate Bridge
Take a ferry to Alcatraz Island and tour the former prison
Explore Fisherman's Wharf and enjoy local seafood
Wander through Chinatown and sample authentic Chinese cuisine
tips_and_tricks: Dress in layers as San Francisco weather can be unpredictable.
Book Alcatraz tickets well in advance to secure a spot.
Try the clam chowder served in a sourdough bread bowl at Fisherman's Wharf.
